meanings.definition: A word or phrase that is the subject of a discussion or analysis.
meanings.sent1: In our class, we had to choose a lemmata to write an essay about.
meanings.sent2: The lemmata of the debate was 'freedom of speech'.
meanings.sent3: The lemmata of the conversation was so interesting that everyone joined in.
meanings.sent4: Her name became the lemmata of gossip in the office.
meanings.sent5: The lemmata of the story was a mysterious treasure map.

meanings.sent1: She found many lemmata in the research papers she was reading.
meanings.sent2: The lemmata in the book were highlighted for easy reference.
meanings.sent3: The lemmata on the page seemed to dance around as she read them.
meanings.sent4: The lemmata in the dictionary were neatly organized in alphabetical order.
meanings.sent5: The lemmata in the list were all related to different scientific studies.
